title: Find X-Sum of All K-Long Subarrays I
description: You are given an array nums of n integers and two integers k and x. The x-sum of an array is calculated by the following procedure: Note that if an array has less than x distinct elements, its x-sum is the sum of the array. Return an integer array answer of length n - k + 1 where answer[i] is the x-sum of the subarray nums[i..i + k - 1].

title: Two Sum
description: Given an array of integers nums and an integer target, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to target. You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution, and you may not use the same element twice. You can return the answer in any order.

title: Add Two Numbers
description: You are given two non-empty linked lists representing two non-negative integers. The digits are stored in reverse order, and each of their nodes contains a single digit. Add the two numbers and return the sum as a linked list. You may assume the two numbers do not contain any leading zero, except the number 0 itself.

title: Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters
description: Given a string s, find the length of the longest substring without duplicate characters.

title: Median of Two Sorted Arrays
description: Given two sorted arrays nums1 and nums2 of size m and n respectively, return the median of the two sorted arrays. The overall run time complexity should be O(log (m+n)).

title: Longest Palindromic Substring
description: Given a string s, return the longest palindromic substring in s.

title: Zigzag Conversion
description: The string "PAYPALISHIRING" is written in a zigzag pattern on a given number of rows like this: (you may want to display this pattern in a fixed font for better legibility) And then read line by line: "PAHNAPLSIIGYIR" Write the code that will take a string and make this conversion given a number of rows:

title: Reverse Integer
description: Given a signed 32-bit integer x, return x with its digits reversed. If reversing x causes the value to go outside the signed 32-bit integer range [-231, 231 - 1], then return 0. Assume the environment does not allow you to store 64-bit integers (signed or unsigned).

title: String to Integer (atoi)
description: Implement the myAtoi(string s) function, which converts a string to a 32-bit signed integer. The algorithm for myAtoi(string s) is as follows: Return the integer as the final result.

title: Palindrome Number
description: Given an integer x, return true if x is a palindrome, and false otherwise.
